name: Teacher training without subject specialisation
description: In the field of Education, this is the study of theories, methods, and practices for equipping teachers to provide children (approx. 5-15 years) with fundamental skills (reading, writing, maths) and a basic understanding of other subjects, laying a foundation for lifelong learning. [cite: 52, 53]

name: Class teacher training
description: Training focused on preparing teachers to manage and teach a class across multiple subjects, typically at the primary or elementary level, falling under Teacher training without subject specialisation. [cite: 55]

name: Indigenous teacher training
description: Specialized teacher training programmes that may not have a specific subject focus but are tailored to indigenous contexts, included within Teacher training without subject specialisation. [cite: 55]

name: Primary teaching
description: Focuses on the methods and practices of teaching at the primary school level, a core area of Teacher training without subject specialisation. [cite: 55]

name: Teacher training for children with special needs
description: This involves training teachers to educate children with special educational needs, and is included in Teacher training without subject specialisation if a specific subject is not the focus. [cite: 53, 55]
